posts.post_content:
I think Ash Zealot is mad because she took a wrong turn somewhere between Phyrexia and Innistrad, causing her to overshoot the Innistrad block entirely. Now she's stuck in Ravnica, breaking Golgari face because she has nothing better to do while waiting for the printing of more flashback spells.  
  
So mad that she will punch the back of your head if she catches you trying to flashback your own cards or sneak in a [Gravecrawler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gravecrawler). She doesn't pick favorites. Now cast your spells from your hand like good little planeswalker. You still hungry for a second serving of that spell? She'll feed you her mace instead, you glutton.
posts.html:
I think Ash Zealot is mad because she took a wrong turn somewhere between Phyrexia and Innistrad, causing her to overshoot the Innistrad block entirely. Now she's stuck in Ravnica, breaking Golgari face because she has nothing better to do while waiting for the printing of more flashback spells.

So mad that she will punch the back of your head if she catches you trying to flashback your own cards or sneak in a Gravecrawler. She doesn't pick favorites. Now cast your spells from your hand like good little planeswalker. You still hungry for a second serving of that spell? She'll feed you her mace instead, you glutton.

Posted By: Superllama12 (3/20/2014 11:09:34 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Hunter06
  
Well, a morningstar is a mace by definition, just as a square is a rectangle. However, I would be more inclined to call this a flanged mace, and not a morningstar, since it doesn't appear to have spikes on it, and spikes are what qualifies the mace to be a morningstar. Just sayin.
  
   
As for the card, I am sure that this is/was/could be a great card in standard or modern. I know that it was decent in limited if only because it was a 2/2 for 2 with first strike and haste.
  
   
In edh, I guess it could be good in a battalion themed deck, maybe? Doesn't get me really excited for EDH, imho.
  
   
4/5 for relevant formats.
posts.html:
@Hunter06
Well, a morningstar is a mace by definition, just as a square is a rectangle. However, I would be more inclined to call this a flanged mace, and not a morningstar, since it doesn't appear to have spikes on it, and spikes are what qualifies the mace to be a morningstar. Just sayin.

As for the card, I am sure that this is/was/could be a great card in standard or modern. I know that it was decent in limited if only because it was a 2/2 for 2 with first strike and haste.

In edh, I guess it could be good in a battalion themed deck, maybe? Doesn't get me really excited for EDH, imho.

4/5 for relevant formats.

posts.post_content: Great card, even better art and random hosing. Besides the biannual mistake cards and even more ridiculous "fixes" for those mistake cards, I think this card best represents WotC's current design philosophy. And as far as the art, obviously flaming maces are awesome and actually functional looking gear on a female character is very refreshing. I'm glad to have four and will jam them in my casual red decks with great pleasure and for great justice.
